item.description:
@Marik wrote:

There is a certain Essence Mining script here somewhere, that mines and returns to the bank, but can’t find the bank counter (It just moves the cursor about, never finding the counter).

Could this “OpenBankQuiet2(X1, Y1, X2, Y2: integer; WhichBank:string):Boolean;” procedure make it find the counter, thus making the script bank the mined ess?

item.title: Cheesehunk's Procedures+Functions
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[quote=“tarajunky, post:16, topic:5221”]I have a question about timed procedures like BoredEvery.

If I ran multiple instances of it, do they run in parallel?

begin; BoredEvery(5); BoredEvery(4); BoredEvery(3); end;

In the above procedure, would this set up 3 seperate timers, or would only the very last one take effect?

The reason I’m asking is because I want to know if I should put this procedure at the very beginning of my scripts in the ‘startup’ procedure, or if I should run it for each character that logs in while the script is still running to sort of reset it.[/quote]

You have to have the BoredEvery(); procedures and stuff inside your FindRandoms, or a special AntiBan that you use throughout the script. If you do not, the script will not be able to check if the timers have reached there limit. I usually incorporate my timing procedures into my FindRandoms;

Also, with this:
[scar]begin
BoredEvery(5);
BoredEvery(4);
BoredEvery(3);
end.[/scar]

If you look inside the BoredEvery procedure it resets the timer to 0 after it excecutes itself:
[scar]procedure BoredEvery(mins: Integer);
begin
if ((TimeFromMark(BoredMark) / 1000) / 60 >= mins) then
begin
MarkTime(BoredMark); // This line resets it.
BoredHuman;
end;
end;[/scar]

So, if you are using all of the timers at the same time it continuosly throughout the script it will catch on the last one everytime. Then it will restart itself, and catch on the last one again.

That may be a bit confusing, get it?

Edit:
I added a new SetMouseSpeedEvery(Seconds : Integer; Speed, Rand : Integer); procedure. See first post for details. I suggest incorporating it into your FindRandoms; procedure for better detectability on the timer.

I hope everyone likes it. If you have any suggestions just ask.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheesehunk's Procedures+Functions
item.dc:creator: @tarajunky tarajunky
item.description:
@tarajunky wrote:

I have a question about timed procedures like BoredEvery.

If I ran multiple instances of it, do they run in parallel?

begin; BoredEvery(5); BoredEvery(4); BoredEvery(3); end;

In the above procedure, would this set up 3 seperate timers, or would only the very last one take effect?

The reason I’m asking is because I want to know if I should put this procedure at the very beginning of my scripts in the ‘startup’ procedure, or if I should run it for each character that logs in while the script is still running to sort of reset it.

Read full topic

I usually use BoredWhileFlagExists in conjuction with IdleWait, RotateScreen, and just regular Flag;. So sometimes it will rotate the screen and move the mouse, sometimes it will just move the mouse, sometimes it will just rotate the screen, and sometimes it will do nothing.

item.title: Cheesehunk's Procedures+Functions
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

I posted these at SRL, and I thought why not post them here?
They are in order of when I made them. From last, to first.

EDIT: Forgot RemainItems was already added to SRL, removed it from post.

EDIT: Made BoredWhileFlagExists(distance); more detectable to if the flag has gone. Also added a wait(10); in the rotate sequence, so sometimes it will not rotate the screen at all! I changed the repeat to a while statement as well.

EDIT: Added new SetMouseSpeedEvery(Seconds : Integer; Speed, Rand : Integer); procedure. Great for changing the MouseSpeed randomly throughout the script.

Current Procedures:7
Current Functions:1

[CENTER][size=15pt]SetMouseSpeedEvery(Seconds : Integer; Speed, Rand : Integer);[/size][/CENTER]

{******************************************************************************* procedure SetMouseSpeedEvery(Seconds : Integer; Speed, Rand : Integer); By: Cheesehunk Description: Will change your MouseSpeed randomly depending on the settings you choose throughout the script. *******************************************************************************}

[PHP]procedure SetMouseSpeedEvery(Seconds : Integer; Speed, Rand : Integer);
begin
if ((TimeFromMark(MouseSpeedMark) /1000) = Seconds) then
begin
MarkTime(MouseSpeedMark);
MouseSpeed:=Speed + Random(Rand);
end;
end;[/PHP]

Example of where to use:

[PHP]
var MouseSpeedMark;

procedure FindRandoms;
begin
FindNormalRandoms;
SetMouseSpeedEvery(200+random(300), 15, 12);
end.

begin
MineRock;
FindRandoms;
WalkToBank;
FindRandoms;
end.[/PHP]

[CENTER][size=15pt]BoredWhileFlagExistsDist(distance : integer);[/size][/CENTER]

{******************************************************************************* procedure BoredWhileFlagExistsDist(distance : integer); By: Cheesehunk Description: Based of Fakawi's BoredHuman. Waits while the flag exists, and acts bored, moving the mosue, and rotating the screen randomly. *******************************************************************************}

[PHP]procedure BoredWhileFlagExistsDist(distance : integer);
begin
while (not(HumanCircleFlag(distance))) or (FlagPresent) do
begin
if (Random(7)=1) then wait(500+random(500));
if HumanCircleFlag(distance) or not(FlagPresent) then Exit;
if (Random(3)=1) then MMouse((Random(MSX1+MSX2))+2/2,Random(MSY1+MSY2)+2/2,0,0);
if HumanCircleFlag(distance) or not(FlagPresent) then Exit;

    Case Random(7) of
      0: SendArrowSilentWait( ((Random(2) * 2) + 1), 1000 + Random(200) );
      1: SendArrowSilentWait( ((Random(2) * 2)), 1000 + Random(200) );
      2: SendArrowSilentWait( ((Random(2) * 2) + 1), 200 + Random(200) );
      3: SendArrowSilentWait( ((Random(2) * 2)), 200 + Random(200) );
      4: SendArrowSilentWait( ((Random(2) * 2) + 1), 20 + Random(20) );
      5: SendArrowSilentWait( ((Random(2) * 2)), 20 + Random(20) );
      6: wait(10); //Doesn't rotate.
    end;

  if HumanCircleFlag(distance) or not(FlagPresent) then Exit;
  if (Random(10)=1) then wait(500+random(500));
  if HumanCircleFlag(distance) or not(FlagPresent) then Exit;
  if (Random(5)=1) then MMouse((Random(MSX1+MSX2))+2/2,Random(MSY1+MSY2)+2/2,0,0);
end;

end;[/PHP]

Example of where to use:

[PHP]
begin
ClickMMColor(BankColor);
if (Random(5)=1) then
begin
BoredWhileFlagExists(10);
end else
Flag;
end.[/PHP]

[CENTER][size=15pt]CheeseBan;[/size][/CENTER]

{******************************************************************************* procedure CheeseBan; By: Cheesehunk Description: Performs Anti-ban actions without rotating the screen, because of RoadWalking. *******************************************************************************}

[PHP]Procedure CheeseBan;
begin
RandomChatEvery(10+random(10));
BoredEvery(10+random(20));
PickUpMouseEvery(5+random(10));
LeaveScreenEvery(5+random(5));
HoverEvery(25+random(20),‘random’);
RandomRClickEvery(15+random(5));
PeeBreakEvery(45+random(45));
SetRunEvery(20+random(10),True);
RandomAntiBanEvery(10+random(15));
end;[/PHP]

Example of where to use:

[PHP]
var RandomAntiBanMark, PeeBreakMark, RunMark: integer;
begin
MarkTime(RandomAntiBanMark);
MarkTime(PeeBreakMark);
MarkTime(RunMark);

Procedure FindRandoms;
begin
FindNormalRandoms;
CheeseBan;
end;

Mouse(x,y,0,0,true);
FindRandoms;
end.[/PHP]

[CENTER][size=15pt]RandomAntiBanEvery(mins : Integer);[/size][/CENTER]

{******************************************************************************* procedure RandomAntiBanEvery(mins : Integer); By: Cheesehunk Description: In a user specified amount of time, it performs some Random AntiBan actions. *******************************************************************************}

[PHP]procedure RandomAntiBanEvery(mins : Integer);
var PantiBan: integer;
UnRounded: Extended;
begin
if ((TimeFromMark(RandomAntiBanMark) /1000) / 60 >= mins) then
begin
MarkTime(RandomAntiBanMark);
UnRounded:=Random(20)+11 / 10;
PantiBan:=Round(UnRounded);
case Pantiban of
1: begin GameTab(12) RandomEmote; end;
2: GameTab(1+Random(12));
3: RClickExamine;
end;
end;
end;[/PHP]

Example of where to use:

[PHP]
var RandomAntiBanMark : integer;
begin
MarkTime(RandomAntiBanMark);
Dostuff;
RandomAntiBanEvery(10+Random(5),True);
end.[/PHP]

[CENTER][size=15pt]SetRunEvery(mins : Integer; Run : Boolean);[/size][/CENTER]

{******************************************************************************* procedure SetRunEvery(mins : Integer; Run : Boolean); By: Cheesehunk Description: Set's the player to run, or walk depending on the amount of time. *******************************************************************************}

[PHP]procedure SetRunEvery(mins : integer; Run : Boolean);
begin
if ((TimeFromMark(RunMark) /1000) / 60 >= mins) then
begin
MarkTime(RunMark);
SetRun(Run);
end;
end;[/PHP]

Example of where to use:

[PHP]
var RunMark : Integer;
begin
MarkTime(RunMark);
Dostuff;
SetRunEvery(20+Random(10));
end.[/PHP]

[CENTER][size=15pt]PeeBreakEvery(mins : Integer);[/size][/CENTER]

{******************************************************************************* procedure PeeBreakEvery(mins : Integer); By: Cheesehunk Description: Leaves the script idle for a while, as if the player were taking a small break for food, or to go to the bathroom. *******************************************************************************}

[PHP]procedure PeeBreakEvery(mins : Integer);
var PeeMark: Integer;
begin
if ((TimeFromMark(PeeBreakMark) / 1000) / 60 >= mins) then
begin
MarkTime(PeeBreakMark);
MarkTime(PeeMark);
repeat
Wait(1);
FindNormalRandoms;
until ((TimeFromMark(PeeMark) >= 15000+Random(60000)) or (not(LoggedIn)))
end;
end;[/PHP]

Example of where to use:

[PHP]
var PeeBreakMark : Integer;
begin
MarkTime(PeeBreakMark);
Dostuff;
PeeBreakEvery(30+random(30));
end.[/PHP]

[CENTER][size=15pt]OpenBankQuiet2(X1, Y1, X2, Y2: integer; WhichBank:string):Boolean;[/size][/CENTER]

[CODE]{*******************************************************************************
function OpenBankQuiet2(X1, Y1, X2, Y2: integer; WhichBank:string):Boolean;
By: WT-Fakawi/Cheesehunk
Description: Searches for any given bank in the free world in a specified area, and opens using
FindDeformedBitmapToleranceIn. Avoids strange mouse movements. Will cause
significant lag (approx. 1 second), but finds the bank with one click. Very useful if you do
not want to take up exyta time looking for the counter in places where it would never be.

Valid arguments are:
‘feb’ (Falador East Bank)
‘fwb’ (Falador West Bank)
‘veb’ (Varrock East Bank)
‘vwb’ (Varrock West Bank)
‘db’ (Draynor Bank)
‘eb’ (Edgeville Bank)
‘akb’ (Al-Kharid Bank)
*******************************************************************************}[/CODE]

[PHP]Function OpenBankQuiet2(X1, Y1, X2, Y2: integer; WhichBank:string):Boolean;
var
VarrockEastCounter, VarrockWestCounter, DraynorCounter,
FaladorEastCounter, FaladorWestCounter, TheCounter,
Dx, Dy, tol, Mark2, Mark3:integer;
var
acc, accthres:extended;
begin
VarrockEastCounter := BitmapFromString(30, 1, ‘z78DA6DC’ +
‘E5D0A80300C03E02BCDD92EE9E3DCF0FE4732EC077D90908F5228’ +
‘9460E689AEDC0C35D13E068DCEAA6E5DDB34E7E2D6524C1D96B7E’ +
‘5B0D0DCCCFF1CF70945095C92CBAE56E6F1C972C4DEE046457B00’ +
‘D4FB2728’);

VarrockWestCounter := BitmapFromString(30, 1, 'z78DA333530B' +
   '130B1304521413484044218DB05C6868A1A98184144CC0C4D5C8C' +
   '8C9149134B6333034B9C24C24C98692011430C930DA1A48BB1235' +
   '0171209001C2C2544');

FaladorEastCounter := BitmapFromString(1, 43, '252323554227644D' +
   '2D6E55337B5F3A7B5F3A6E5A336E5A33968979948778928677928' +
   '677756D6383786A8D7F6F9586719C8B7687683F8C6D42896E4D80' +
   '68498068497D65487D65487A63467A6346776145776145755F437' +
   '55F436E5533715735775C38775C387762388F6F43816A3B7E683A' +
   '816A3B9276547E683A846C3D746036');

FaladorWestCounter := BitmapFromString(1, 29, '98887381' +
   '633B87683F7D6548836A4A7D65487D65487A63467A63467A63467' +
   '76145776145755F43755F436B52316B52316E5533715735775C38' +
   'A1835C9F815B8C6D428C6D428C6D428C6D427B643A7B643A74603' +
   '68B866F');

DraynorCounter := BitmapFromString(34, 1, 'z78DA658E4B0' +  // works too for al karid
   'E80300844AF34FCB45DAA70FF2B89B40B12339997F0C980BA5C98' +
   '06837A7AE828CE74551F77FF51CBCD1FC5D901369614282816E59' +
   '683EF94207AF2BA55C9948672BFB2FB7D5A1F6E8A10D0C9274552' +
   '39FD022AE92A73');

case WhichBank of
‘feb’: TheCounter := FaladorEastCounter;
‘fwb’: TheCounter := FaladorWestCounter;
‘vwb’: TheCounter := VarrockWestCounter;
‘veb’: TheCounter := VarrockEastCounter;
‘akb’: TheCounter := DraynorCounter;
‘db’ : TheCounter := DraynorCounter;
‘eb’ : TheCounter := DraynorCounter;
end;

SendArrowSilentWait(0,1000+Random(500));
MarkTime(Mark3);
Tol:=1;
accthres:=0.6;
repeat
FindDeformedBitmapToleranceIn(TheCounter, Dx, Dy, X1, Y1, X2, Y2, tol, 4, True, acc);
if (acc >= accthres) then
begin
MMouse(Dx, Dy, 0, 0);
if IsUpTextMulti(‘e Bank’,‘Booth’,‘ooth’) then
begin
GetMousePos(Dx, Dy);
Mouse(Dx, Dy, 0, 0, False);
if ChooseOption(Dx, Dy, ‘uickly’) then
begin
MarkTime(Mark2);
repeat
Wait(10);
if TimeFromMark(Mark2) > 20000 then
begin
writeln(‘couldnt find the bank. Exiting’);
Exit;
end;
until BankScreen;
end;
Result := True;
Exit;
end;
end;
wait(100);
FindNormalRandoms;
tol := tol + 4; if tol >= 20 then
begin
tol := 1;
accthres := accthres - 0.1;
if accthres < 0.2 then
begin
writeln(‘couldnt find the bank. Exiting’);
Exit;
end;
end;
until TimeFromMark(Mark3) > 60000;

FreeBitMap(VarrockEastCounter);
FreeBitMap(VarrockWestCounter);
FreeBitMap(FaladorEastCounter);
FreeBitMap(FaladorWestCounter);
FreeBitMap(DraynorCounter);
end;[/PHP]

Example of where to use:

[PHP]begin
repeat
OpenBankQuiet2(160, 80, 460, 200,‘akb’);
until(BankScreen);
end.[/PHP]

[CENTER][size=15pt]RClickExamine;[/size][/CENTER]

{******************************************************************************* procedure RClickExamine; by: Cheesehunk, based of Fakawi's BoredHuman; Description: Randomly right clicks somewhere on the screen, then chooses to either Examine the item, Cancel the option, or Just move the mouse away, and not choose an option. *******************************************************************************}

[PHP]Procedure RClickExamine;
begin
begin
MMouse(Random(MSX2), Random(MSY2), 0, 0);
If IsUpText(‘opti’) then
begin
GetMousePos(x,y);
Mouse(x, y, 0, 0, False);
case Random(3) of
0: ChooseOption(x, y, ‘Examine’);
1: ChooseOption(x, y, ‘Cancel’);
2: MMouse(Random(MSX2), Random(MSY2), 0, 0);
end;
Wait(Random(50) + Random(50));
end;
end;[/PHP]

Example of where to use:

[PHP]begin
repeat
MineOre;
if Random(30) = 1 then
begin
RClickExamine;
end;
until(false)
end.[/PHP]

I am thinking of more procedures to put in, and will input more later.

Please give feeback, and suggestions.

Thanks,
Cheesehunk.

P.S. I think this section should be SRL Members only…

Read full topic
